title: SentinelOne Resellers
text:
Ok so now just finding out about the bullshit minimum spend for Pax8 with less than 2 months notice.

0-$499. $500 or above no $25/month fee. So I'm gonna raise the rates mid contract for certain customers and expect to get away with that? That customer is gonna walk when their contract is done. For the grief, time, and money this company has cost me with their inadequate support & clueless reps it's not worth it.

Haven't been happy with them since my first shit interaction.

Who else resells SentinelOne Complete other than Pax8?

comments.text:
I don't understand the balking. Are you under 20 licenses total or something?

Why would a client walk over $25? 

Whats happening?

Where am I?
I don't think they will miss you.
What minimum spend?  Pax8 is great I took on a client that was using it before, 50ish seats.  No problem.  Iâ€™ve gone to huntress and have just a handful left, they bill it no problem.
They'll be happy to see a very mini customer leave. Imagine how little profit they make on you, distribution is all about volume, you cost them more in man hours.
Do you want a soc attached to it or just the licenses?

I just enrolled with Pax and can confirm they are introduced a tiered structure. If you sell less that $500 a month it cost $25 a month to use their services but you have 90 days to get to that 500 after they introduce it.
According to my email the fee is waived for 1 year for existing clients.
Happy to give you S1 licenses with no minimums and no prices or fees. I'm happy to help in anyway I can.
